comments:
Testing the 0729 release candidate. Using Tomcat 5.0.28 and Sun JDK 1.4.2_06.

I created a fresh workspace and ran a simple JSP OK. I then created a simple 
Java class and got the following error when I tried to deploy it as a Web 
service.


IWAB0024E Error in copying Webservice Utility file.

INF/server-config.wsdd

javax.mail.internet.MimeMultipart). Attachment support is disabled.
- Unable to find config file.  Creating new servlet engine config file: /WEB-
INF/server-config.wsdd

More info. I started Tomcat with a JRE first and got the usual error message 
when it tried to compile the JSP. I then switch to a JDK so the JSP would 
compile. When I tried to deploy the Web service, I got the error: IWAB0024E 
Error in copying Webservice Utility file.

I then shut down Eclipse and restarted. This time I could deploy the Web 
service so I am downgrading the severity to normal.

This is a weird problem but not stop ship.

FYI, when I restarted and reployed the Web service, I got a build error - 
unable to find .deployables in the WebClient project. Also, the Web service JSP 
test client had 3 errors in the Tomcat console but still worked. I think these 
are known problems.

Jul 29, 2005 3:03:36 PM org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext reload

- Unable to find required classes (javax.activation.DataHandler and 
javax.mail.internet.MimeMultipart). Attachment support is disabled.

I wouldn't worry about the error message in the Tomcat log file. That error 
message is actually expected. When the Axis servlet starts up, it does a check 
to see whether the javax.activation.DataHandler class is on the Webapp's 
classpath. If it is not, it spits out the error message to the log. Check out 
org.apache.axis.utils.JavaUtils's isAttachmentSupported() method...

if(!attachmentSupportEnabled) {
  log.warn(Messages.getMessage("attachDisabled"));

So I don't think this is related to the recent activation fix.

The warning in the Tomcat server log:

- Unable to find required classes (javax.activation.DataHandler and 
javax.mail.internet.MimeMultipart). Attachment support is disabled.

is expected.  It's just a warning from Axis that Attachment support is 
disabled.  We got the same warning with Tomcat 5.0 before the fix for 105335 
was put in.  I'll mention in the Known Problem section of New & Noteworthy.

As for "Error in copying Webservice Utility file", do you have the 
org.eclipse.jst.ws.consumption plugin in the workspace?  If so, you'll have to 
do the following:

1. highlight plugin.xml in that plugin, right-click and select PDE Tools -> 
Create Ant Build file.
2. Select build.xml run Ant Build.

If you don't have that plugin in the workspace, check to see if 
webserviceutils.jar is in your target platform in 
org.eclipse.jst.ws.consumption.  Since you were fine on second try, I suspect 
the JAR is there.  If that's the case, let's see if we could reproduce the 
problem consistently.

For the problem of JSP compile problem in the console complaining about 
package org.eclipse.jst.ws.util does not exist, it's a timing problem and is 
documented in defect 85823:

https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=85823

The build error "unable to find .deployables in the WebClient project" is also 
a known problem documented in defect 105462:

https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=105462 

Both of these are documented in the New and Noteworthy document for Web 
services.

I opened defect 105611 for the warning about "attachment support is disabled".

I also tried using a fresh workspace with the RC5 driver.  I was able to create 
bottom-up Web service without running in the "Error in copying Webservice 
Utility file".  Please provide exact steps if you are able to reproduce the 
problem consistently.

I tried the wtp-all-in-one-0.7-win32.zip using Tomcat 5.0.28 and Sun JDK 
1.4.2_06.  Using a fresh workspace, I was able to create a simple Java class 
and create a Web service from it using the Web Service wizard.  I did get 
the "Error during build" (defect 105462).  But other than that, I was able to 
run the generated JSP no problem (no Error in copying Webservice Utility 
file).  Are you able to reproduce it again?  If so, what are the exact steps?

Hi Gil,

Arthur ran into this problem once with the 0.7 All-in-one driver but I had not 
been able to reproduce it but the problem went away after restarting Eclipse. 
May be you could take a look at the code to see if there could be some weird 
timing issue which would cause this "Error in copying Webservice Utility file" 
to happen intermittenly?  If you can't identify the possible source of the 
problem or reproduce it and Arthur is not able to provide more detail on the 
steps, we might have to return this as "WorksForMe".
The previous comment was made by Kathy Chan on behalf of Chris Brealey.

Gil,

I think I narrowed down the cause of this "Error in copying Webservice Utility 
file" problem.  With the WTP 07 All-in-one driver, if you go through a bottom-
up or top-down Web service creation scenario, select "Test Web service" and do 
not "generate proxy", the wizard is still trying to copy the 
webserviceutils.jar into the proxy project (this should not be done since we 
are only testing with the WSE).  Since the proxy project does not exist, you 
get a NPE.  The reason I had not get the problem before was I usually 
select "generate proxy" together with "test the Web service".  Arthur probably 
had done the same the first time but when he repeat a second time, he 
selected "generate proxy".  I'm able to reproduce the problem 100% of the time 
now.

Here's the trace:

Gil, targetting to fix in M9.
